wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Watts (21 August 1899 – 19 January 1976) was an English first-class cricketer active 1921–26 who played for Surrey. He was born in Kennington; died in St Helens, Lancashire.

response: * Thomas Watts (1868–1951) (1868–1951), British Conservative Party Member of Parliament
* Thomas Watts (1689–1742) (died 1742), English Member of Parliament, academy master and leading figure at the Sun Fire Office
* Thomas Watts (cricketer) (1899–1976), English first-class cricketer for Surrey
